products.name: Kashi/Oak Bachi

type.short-description:
Kashi bachi are the heaviest and hardest wood type that are perfect for larger drums such as the nagado taiko.
[Made in Japan]

products.name: Kaede/Maple Bachi

type.short-description:
A little softer than kashi/oak, kaede/maple is also great to use while playing larger drums, such as nagado or chudaiko and tapered bachi are useful when playing set or small drums.
[Made in Japan]

products.name: Nagado Taiko

type.name: 1.3shaku (39cm) keyaki
type.short-description: The most typical style of drum exemplifying "taiko" as an instrument is the nagado (long-bodied) style of taiko. Each nagado-taiko is carved from a single, solid piece of wood. The types of wood we use for the body can be divided into two broad categories, keyaki and meari. Keyaki (zelkova serrata) is a premium hardwood considered to be the best material for taiko body construction. Meari is a broad term referring to a number of types of wood that can include camphor, horse chestnut, sen and bubinga.　[Made in Japan]

products.name: Shimejishi: Asano Taiko+0K0odo
products.description:
Drum size: 1.2shaku (36cm/14.5in)
Body Length: 47cm (18.5in)

This drum is similar to a katsugi.
One piece wood and has horse hide on one side and cow on the other.

Included Take/Bamboo bachi.

[Made in Japan]
